intro: Ribes uva-crispa lusus leucocarpum, commonly known as the white-fruited gooseberry, is a variant of the European gooseberry. It is a deciduous shrub belonging to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, white or pale yellow berries. It typically grows in woodland areas and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. The fruit is edible but has a tart flavor, making it suitable for jams and wines.
